description: Next.js project bootstraps and dev server starts on port 3000
acceptanceCriteria: Given the repo is cloned and dependencies installed
When I run pnpm dev
Then the server starts on http://localhost:3000 within 10 seconds
steps: Step 1: Clone the repository
Step 2: Run pnpm install
Step 3: Copy .env.example to .env
Step 4: Start PostgreSQL via docker compose up -d
Step 5: Run pnpm dev
Step 6: Verify http://localhost:3000 responds with 200
Step 7: Verify /api/v1/health returns { success: true }
edgeCases: Port 3000 already in use → clear error message
Missing .env → fallback to defaults with warning
PostgreSQL not running → clear connection error

description: PostgreSQL database connection and schema migrations run successfully
acceptanceCriteria: Given PostgreSQL is running
When the application starts
Then all database tables are created via Drizzle migrations
steps: Step 1: Ensure PostgreSQL is running on configured DATABASE_URL
Step 2: Run pnpm db:migrate
Step 3: Verify users table exists
Step 4: Verify trading_pairs table exists
Step 5: Verify orders table exists
Step 6: Verify trades table exists
Step 7: Verify wallets table exists
Step 8: Verify candles table exists
Step 9: Verify all enum types are created
Step 10: Verify indexes are created
edgeCases: Migration run twice → idempotent, no errors
Database already has tables → migration skips existing
Invalid DATABASE_URL → clear error with instructions
notes: All 14 tables from spec must exist

description: Seed data populates trading pairs and admin user on first run
acceptanceCriteria: Given the database is freshly migrated
When the seed script runs
Then 5 trading pairs and 1 admin user are created
steps: Step 1: Run pnpm db:seed
Step 2: Verify BTC_USDT pair exists with correct precision
Step 3: Verify ETH_USDT pair exists
Step 4: Verify ETH_BTC pair exists
Step 5: Verify DOGE_USDT pair exists
Step 6: Verify XRP_USDT pair exists
Step 7: Verify admin user exists with role='admin'
Step 8: Verify admin can login with seed credentials
Step 9: Verify seed is idempotent (run twice, no duplicates)
edgeCases: Seed run on populated DB → skip existing, no errors
Missing ADMIN_SEED_EMAIL env → use defaults

description: WebSocket server accepts connections on ws://localhost:3000/ws
acceptanceCriteria: Given the dev server is running
When a client connects to ws://localhost:3000/ws
Then the connection is established and server responds to PING
steps: Step 1: Start the dev server
Step 2: Open WebSocket connection to ws://localhost:3000/ws
Step 3: Verify connection opens successfully
Step 4: Send PING message
Step 5: Receive PONG response
Step 6: Verify connection stays alive for 30+ seconds
Step 7: Close connection gracefully
edgeCases: Multiple simultaneous connections → all accepted
Invalid URL path → connection rejected
No pong within 10s → server disconnects client
notes: WebSocket and HTTP share port 3000 via upgrade

description: Dark theme is the default with Binance-inspired color system
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user visits the site for the first time
When the page loads
Then the dark theme is applied with correct color tokens
steps: Step 1: Navigate to http://localhost:3000
Step 2: Verify background color is near #0B0E11 (dark)
Step 3: Verify text color is near #EAECEF (light)
Step 4: Verify green (#0ECB81) is used for buy/positive
Step 5: Verify red (#F6465D) is used for sell/negative
Step 6: Verify card backgrounds use #1E2329
Step 7: Verify no white flash on initial load
edgeCases: System prefers-color-scheme: light → still dark (dark is default)
CSS variables are defined and accessible

description: Top navigation bar renders with logo, nav links, and user menu
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user visits any page
When the page loads
Then the top navbar is visible with Markets, Trade, Wallet, Orders links
steps: Step 1: Navigate to http://localhost:3000
Step 2: Verify navbar is fixed at top
Step 3: Verify logo/brand is visible on the left
Step 4: Verify Markets link is present
Step 5: Verify Trade link is present
Step 6: Verify Wallet link is present (or Login if not authenticated)
Step 7: Verify Orders link is present (or Login if not authenticated)
Step 8: Verify theme toggle button exists
Step 9: Verify Login/Register buttons when not authenticated
Step 10: Click each nav link and verify navigation
edgeCases: Unauthenticated → show Login/Register instead of Wallet/Orders
Navbar stays fixed on scroll

description: User can register with email and password
acceptanceCriteria: Given no account exists for the email
When a user submits registration with valid email and strong password
Then an account is created with status active and the user receives JWT tokens
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /register
Step 2: Enter valid email address
Step 3: Enter password meeting requirements (8+ chars, uppercase, lowercase, number)
Step 4: See real-time password strength indicator
Step 5: Accept terms of service checkbox
Step 6: Click Create Account
Step 7: Verify redirect to trading page or dashboard
Step 8: Verify JWT tokens are stored (cookie or localStorage)
Step 9: Verify user appears in database with role='user', status='active'
Step 10: Verify kyc_level='level_0'
edgeCases: Duplicate email → inline error 'Email already registered'
Weak password → show specific requirements not met
SQL injection in email → sanitized, rejected
Empty fields → validation errors shown

description: User can login with email and password and receive JWT tokens
acceptanceCriteria: Given a registered user exists
When they submit correct email and password
Then they receive accessToken and refreshToken
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /login
Step 2: Enter registered email
Step 3: Enter correct password
Step 4: Click Login
Step 5: Verify accessToken is returned (15min expiry)
Step 6: Verify refreshToken is returned (7 day expiry)
Step 7: Verify redirect to trading page
Step 8: Verify navbar shows user menu instead of Login/Register
Step 9: Verify login_history record is created
edgeCases: Wrong password → 401 with 'Invalid credentials'
Non-existent email → 401 (same message, no enumeration)
5 failed attempts → account temporarily locked (30 min)
Suspended user → 403 'Account suspended'

description: JWT access token refresh works before expiry
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has a valid refresh token
When they call the refresh endpoint
Then they receive a new access token
steps: Step 1: Login to get accessToken and refreshToken
Step 2: Call POST /api/v1/auth/refresh with refreshToken
Step 3: Verify new accessToken is returned
Step 4: Verify new accessToken works for authenticated endpoints
Step 5: Verify old accessToken still works until expiry
edgeCases: Expired refresh token → 401
Invalid refresh token → 401
Revoked refresh token (after logout) → 401

description: Wallet balances can be queried for authenticated user
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user
When they call GET /api/v1/wallet/balances
Then they receive all currency balances with available and frozen amounts
steps: Step 1: Login as test user
Step 2: Call GET /api/v1/wallet/balances with auth header
Step 3: Verify response contains array of balance objects
Step 4: Each balance has currency, available, frozen, total fields
Step 5: Verify total = available + frozen for each currency
Step 6: Verify unauthorized request returns 401
Step 7: Verify new user has empty balances
edgeCases: No wallets yet → return empty array
Expired token → 401

description: Simulated deposit credits user balance with confirmation animation
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user
When they submit a deposit request
Then their balance is credited after simulated confirmation delay
steps: Step 1: Login as user
Step 2: Navigate to wallet deposit page
Step 3: Select currency (USDT)
Step 4: Enter amount (10000)
Step 5: Click Deposit
Step 6: See confirmation progress animation (1/3, 2/3, 3/3)
Step 7: See 'Completed' status after ~3 seconds
Step 8: Verify balance increased by deposit amount
Step 9: Verify deposit record in deposits table
Step 10: Verify wallet_transaction record created
edgeCases: Zero amount → validation error
Negative amount → validation error
Very large amount → accepted (demo mode)
verify: curl -s -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/wallet/deposit -H 'Authorization: Bearer TOKEN' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"currency":"USDT","amount":"10000"}' | jq .success

description: Public market pairs API returns all active trading pairs
acceptanceCriteria: Given trading pairs are seeded
When calling GET /api/v1/market/pairs
Then all active pairs are returned with their configuration
steps: Step 1: Call GET /api/v1/market/pairs (no auth required)
Step 2: Verify response contains 5 pairs
Step 3: Each pair has symbol, baseCurrency, quoteCurrency
Step 4: Each pair has pricePrecision, amountPrecision
Step 5: Each pair has minAmount, minTotal
Step 6: Each pair has makerFeeBps, takerFeeBps
Step 7: Each pair has status = 'active'
Step 8: Verify suspended pairs are excluded
edgeCases: No pairs exist → empty array
Mix of active and suspended → only active returned

description: Matching engine processes limit orders with price-time priority
acceptanceCriteria: Given the matching engine is running
When a buy limit order crosses with a resting sell order
Then a trade is executed at the maker's price
steps: Step 1: Place sell limit order: 1.0 BTC @ 50000 USDT (user A)
Step 2: Place buy limit order: 1.0 BTC @ 50000 USDT (user B)
Step 3: Verify trade is created with price=50000, amount=1.0
Step 4: Verify sell order status is 'filled'
Step 5: Verify buy order status is 'filled'
Step 6: Verify buyer receives BTC (minus taker fee)
Step 7: Verify seller receives USDT (minus maker fee)
Step 8: Verify wallet_transactions are recorded
Step 9: Verify trade.seq is monotonically increasing
Step 10: Place two sells at same price, verify earlier one fills first
edgeCases: Empty order book → limit order rests in book
Buy price > ask → fills at ask price (buyer gets better price)
Multiple price levels → fills best price first
Exact same timestamp → order with lower seq fills first
notes: Core matching engine - most critical feature

description: Order placement API validates input and freezes balance
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user with sufficient balance
When they place a valid limit order
Then the order is accepted and the required balance is frozen
steps: Step 1: Deposit 100000 USDT to test user
Step 2: Place buy limit order: 1.0 BTC @ 50000
Step 3: Verify order returned with status='new'
Step 4: Verify USDT available decreased by 50000
Step 5: Verify USDT frozen increased by 50000
Step 6: Place sell limit order: test with BTC balance
Step 7: Verify BTC available decreased, frozen increased
Step 8: Attempt order with insufficient balance → 400 error
Step 9: Attempt order with invalid precision → 400 error
Step 10: Attempt order below min_amount → 400 error
edgeCases: Insufficient balance → 400 INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE
Invalid symbol → 400 INVALID_SYMBOL
Amount below min → 400 AMOUNT_TOO_SMALL
Price precision exceeds pair config → 400
Negative price or amount → 400
verify: curl -s -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/orders -H 'Authorization: Bearer TOKEN' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"symbol":"BTC_USDT","side":"buy","type":"limit","price":"50000","amount":"0.1"}' | jq .data.status

description: Order cancellation unfreezes balance
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has an open order with frozen balance
When they cancel the order
Then the order status changes to cancelled and frozen balance is restored
steps: Step 1: Place a limit buy order (50000 USDT frozen)
Step 2: Verify frozen balance increased
Step 3: Call DELETE /api/v1/orders/:orderId
Step 4: Verify order status is 'cancelled'
Step 5: Verify USDT available increased by 50000
Step 6: Verify USDT frozen decreased by 50000
Step 7: Attempt to cancel same order again → 400 error
edgeCases: Cancel already filled order → 400 ORDER_NOT_CANCELLABLE
Cancel already cancelled order → 400
Cancel another user's order → 403
Cancel non-existent order → 404

description: Trade settlement atomically updates both users' wallets
acceptanceCriteria: Given two orders match
When the trade is settled
Then both users' wallets are updated atomically in a single DB transaction
steps: Step 1: User A deposits 100000 USDT, User B deposits 2 BTC
Step 2: User B places sell 1.0 BTC @ 50000
Step 3: User A places buy 1.0 BTC @ 50000
Step 4: Verify trade is created
Step 5: Verify User A: USDT decreased, BTC increased (minus taker fee)
Step 6: Verify User B: BTC decreased (frozen released), USDT increased (minus maker fee)
Step 7: Verify total system balance is conserved (minus fees)
Step 8: Verify wallet_transactions for all movements
edgeCases: DB error during settlement → transaction rolls back, no partial state
Fees round down (never overcharge)

description: Order book depth API returns aggregated bid/ask levels
acceptanceCriteria: Given there are orders in the book
When calling GET /api/v1/market/depth/:symbol
Then sorted bids (desc) and asks (asc) with aggregated quantities are returned
steps: Step 1: Place multiple sell orders at different prices
Step 2: Place multiple buy orders at different prices
Step 3: Call GET /api/v1/market/depth/BTC_USDT?limit=20
Step 4: Verify bids are sorted descending by price
Step 5: Verify asks are sorted ascending by price
Step 6: Verify multiple orders at same price are summed
Step 7: Verify limit parameter controls depth levels
edgeCases: Empty book → empty bids and asks arrays
Only bids → asks empty
limit=0 → use default (20)

description: Demo mode banner displays at the top of every page
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user visits any page
When the page loads
Then a persistent banner shows 'Demo Exchange — No real funds'
steps: Step 1: Navigate to http://localhost:3000
Step 2: Verify banner is visible at the top of the page
Step 3: Verify banner text includes 'Demo' or 'demo'
Step 4: Navigate to /trade/BTC_USDT
Step 5: Verify banner is still visible
Step 6: Dismiss the banner (if dismissible)
Step 7: Verify dismissal persists across page navigations
edgeCases: Banner dismissal stored in localStorage
New session → banner reappears

description: Monospace font is used for all numeric/financial data
acceptanceCriteria: Given financial data is displayed
When viewing prices, amounts, or balances
Then monospace font with tabular-nums is applied
steps: Step 1: Navigate to trading page
Step 2: Inspect price elements → font-family includes monospace
Step 3: Inspect amount elements → font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums
Step 4: Verify order book numbers are aligned vertically
Step 5: Verify balance display uses monospace
Step 6: Navigate to wallet page and repeat checks
edgeCases: Non-numeric text uses sans-serif font
Mixed content (labels + numbers) uses appropriate fonts

description: Loading skeleton placeholders display while data is fetching
acceptanceCriteria: Given a page is loading data
When data has not yet arrived
Then skeleton placeholders are shown in place of content
steps: Step 1: Navigate to trading page
Step 2: Observe skeleton loaders for chart, order book, recent trades
Step 3: Verify skeletons match the shape of the actual content
Step 4: Verify skeletons disappear when data loads
Step 5: Navigate to wallet page
Step 6: Observe skeleton loaders for balance cards
edgeCases: Slow connection → skeletons visible for longer
Error loading data → error state replaces skeleton

description: Trading page displays the full Binance-style layout with chart, order book, order form, and trades
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user navigates to /trade/BTC_USDT
When the page loads
Then all trading panels are visible in the correct layout
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /trade/BTC_USDT
Step 2: Verify chart panel occupies ~55% width
Step 3: Verify order book panel occupies ~20% width
Step 4: Verify order form panel occupies ~25% width
Step 5: Verify recent trades section is visible
Step 6: Verify open orders table at the bottom
Step 7: Verify trading pair header with price and stats
Step 8: Verify WebSocket connection indicator
edgeCases: Invalid pair in URL → redirect to default pair or 404
Page maintains layout on window resize > 1024px

description: Order book component shows real-time bids and asks with depth bars
acceptanceCriteria: Given the trading page is loaded
When orders exist in the book
Then bids (green) and asks (red) are displayed with cumulative depth bars
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /trade/BTC_USDT with orders in the book
Step 2: Verify asks (sell orders) displayed at top in red
Step 3: Verify spread displayed in the middle
Step 4: Verify bids (buy orders) displayed at bottom in green
Step 5: Verify depth bars show cumulative volume
Step 6: Verify clicking a price fills the order form price field
Step 7: Verify precision selector dropdown works
Step 8: Verify three display modes: Both/Asks/Bids
Step 9: Place a new order and verify book updates in real-time
Step 10: Cancel an order and verify book updates
edgeCases: Empty book → show 'No orders' placeholder
Very large order → depth bar fills 100%
Rapid updates → throttled to prevent visual chaos

description: Order form supports limit and market order placement with buy/sell toggle
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user is on the trading page
When they fill out the order form and submit
Then the order is placed via API and reflected in open orders
steps: Step 1: Verify Limit/Market tabs in order form
Step 2: Select Limit tab
Step 3: Toggle between Buy (green) and Sell (red)
Step 4: Enter price with stepper buttons (+/-)
Step 5: Enter amount
Step 6: See auto-calculated total
Step 7: Use percentage slider (25/50/75/100%)
Step 8: See available balance displayed
Step 9: Click Buy/Sell button
Step 10: Verify order appears in Open Orders table
Step 11: Switch to Market tab and verify simplified form (no price field)
Step 12: Verify fee estimation shown
edgeCases: Not logged in → show 'Login to Trade' button instead of form
Insufficient balance → button disabled with message
Invalid inputs → inline validation errors

description: Open orders table shows user's active orders with cancel action
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has open orders
When viewing the open orders tab
Then all open orders are listed with cancel buttons
steps: Step 1: Place several limit orders
Step 2: Navigate to Open Orders tab at bottom of trading page
Step 3: Verify columns: Pair, Type, Side, Price, Amount, Filled, Status, Action
Step 4: Verify each row has a Cancel button
Step 5: Click Cancel on an order
Step 6: Verify order disappears from Open Orders
Step 7: Verify order appears in Order History with status='cancelled'
Step 8: Verify balance unfrozen
edgeCases: No open orders → show empty state message
Cancel fails (already filled) → error toast
Real-time update: order fills while viewing → row updates

description: Order history table shows past orders with fill details
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has completed or cancelled orders
When viewing the Order History tab
Then past orders are shown with final status and fill information
steps: Step 1: Complete several trades (fill orders)
Step 2: Cancel an order (partial or full)
Step 3: Navigate to Order History tab
Step 4: Verify filled orders show status='filled' in green
Step 5: Verify cancelled orders show status='cancelled' in grey
Step 6: Verify partially filled then cancelled shows filled amount
Step 7: Verify pagination works for many orders
Step 8: Verify average fill price shown for filled orders
edgeCases: No history → empty state
100+ orders → pagination works

description: WebSocket depth channel pushes real-time order book updates
acceptanceCriteria: Given a client subscribes to depth@BTC_USDT
When the order book changes
Then incremental updates are pushed with lastUpdateId sequence
steps: Step 1: Connect to WebSocket
Step 2: Subscribe to depth@BTC_USDT@20
Step 3: Receive full snapshot with bids, asks, lastUpdateId
Step 4: Subscribe to depth@BTC_USDT for incremental updates
Step 5: Place an order via REST API
Step 6: Verify incremental update received with new level
Step 7: Cancel the order
Step 8: Verify incremental update received (level removed or qty reduced)
Step 9: Verify lastUpdateId is monotonically increasing
edgeCases: Rapid updates → batched at 100ms intervals
Subscribe to non-existent pair → error message

description: WebSocket trade channel pushes real-time trade executions
acceptanceCriteria: Given a client subscribes to trade@BTC_USDT
When a trade executes
Then the trade is pushed within 100ms
steps: Step 1: Connect to WebSocket and subscribe to trade@BTC_USDT
Step 2: Place matching orders to trigger a trade
Step 3: Verify trade message received with price, amount, side, timestamp
Step 4: Verify message arrives within 100ms of trade execution
Step 5: Place multiple trades and verify all are received in order
edgeCases: High-frequency trades → all delivered, none dropped
Client disconnects and reconnects → gets snapshot on reconnect

description: WebSocket ticker channel pushes 24h market statistics
acceptanceCriteria: Given a client subscribes to ticker@BTC_USDT
When a trade occurs or every second
Then updated ticker data is pushed with lastPrice, 24h change, volume
steps: Step 1: Connect to WebSocket and subscribe to ticker@BTC_USDT
Step 2: Verify initial ticker data received
Step 3: Execute a trade
Step 4: Verify updated lastPrice in next ticker push
Step 5: Verify 24h high/low/volume fields
Step 6: Subscribe to ticker@ALL and verify all pairs included
edgeCases: No trades in 24h → ticker still pushes with zero change
Multiple pairs → each pair's ticker independent

description: Private WebSocket channels push order and wallet updates to authenticated users
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user subscribes to private channels
When their order status changes or balance updates
Then they receive real-time notifications
steps: Step 1: Connect to WebSocket with auth token
Step 2: Send AUTH message with JWT
Step 3: Subscribe to 'orders' and 'wallet' channels
Step 4: Place an order via REST → receive order.placed on WS
Step 5: When order fills → receive order.filled on WS
Step 6: Verify wallet balance update received on WS
Step 7: Cancel an order → receive order.cancelled on WS
edgeCases: Subscribe without auth → error response
Token expires during session → server sends auth-required message
User A cannot receive User B's private events

description: Recent trades panel shows live trade feed with color-coded buy/sell
acceptanceCriteria: Given the trading page is loaded
When trades execute
Then they appear in the recent trades panel with green (buy) or red (sell) coloring
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /trade/BTC_USDT
Step 2: Verify recent trades panel shows time, price, amount columns
Step 3: Execute a buy-side trade
Step 4: Verify new trade appears at top of list in green
Step 5: Execute a sell-side trade
Step 6: Verify new trade appears at top in red
Step 7: Verify list scrolls to show new trades
Step 8: Verify maximum ~50 trades displayed
edgeCases: No trades yet → show empty state
Rapid trades → all displayed without lag

description: Trading pair header bar shows last price, 24h change, high/low, and volume
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user is on the trading page
When viewing the pair header
Then live price (flashing on change), 24h stats, and favorite toggle are visible
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /trade/BTC_USDT
Step 2: Verify pair name 'BTC/USDT' displayed
Step 3: Verify last price shown prominently
Step 4: Verify 24h change percentage (green/red)
Step 5: Verify 24h high, low, volume stats
Step 6: Click star icon to toggle favorite
Step 7: Click pair name to open pair selector
Step 8: Execute a trade and verify price updates with flash animation
edgeCases: No trades → show '--' for price
Price increase → green flash, price decrease → red flash

description: Market orders execute immediately at best available price with optional slippage protection
acceptanceCriteria: Given there are resting orders in the book
When a user places a market order
Then it fills immediately at the best available prices
steps: Step 1: Populate order book with sell orders at various prices
Step 2: Place market buy order for 1.0 BTC
Step 3: Verify order fills at best ask prices
Step 4: Verify order walks the book if quantity exceeds best level
Step 5: Verify filled amount and average price in response
Step 6: Test with maxSlippage parameter
Step 7: Place market order exceeding slippage → partial fill + cancel remainder
Step 8: Place market order on empty book → rejected with insufficient_liquidity
edgeCases: Empty book → rejected
Partial liquidity → fills what's available, cancels rest
maxSlippage exceeded → partial fill + cancel

description: TradingView Lightweight Charts renders candlestick chart with real-time updates
acceptanceCriteria: Given the trading page is loaded
When historical candle data is available
Then a professional candlestick chart renders with live updates
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /trade/BTC_USDT
Step 2: Verify chart panel renders with candlestick data
Step 3: Verify green candles for price increase, red for decrease
Step 4: Verify volume bars below candles
Step 5: Verify crosshair shows OHLCV on hover
Step 6: Verify chart updates in real-time when trades execute
Step 7: Verify chart resizes when window resizes
Step 8: Test fullscreen toggle
edgeCases: No candle data → show empty chart with message
Single candle → renders correctly
Very long history → chart scrolls/zooms

description: Chart time interval selector supports 1m to 1W periods
acceptanceCriteria: Given the chart is displayed
When the user selects a different time interval
Then the chart reloads with candles for that interval
steps: Step 1: Verify time interval buttons: 1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1H, 4H, 1D, 1W
Step 2: Click 1H button
Step 3: Verify chart updates with 1-hour candles
Step 4: Verify active interval button is highlighted
Step 5: Click 1m button
Step 6: Verify chart updates with 1-minute candles
Step 7: Verify WS subscription changes to new interval
edgeCases: No data for selected interval → show empty chart
Switch interval while loading → cancel previous, load new

description: Candle aggregation engine computes correct OHLCV from trades
acceptanceCriteria: Given trades execute during a candle period
When the candle period ends
Then the candle has correct open, high, low, close, and volume
steps: Step 1: Execute trade at price 50000 (first in period → open)
Step 2: Execute trade at price 50100 (new high)
Step 3: Execute trade at price 49900 (new low)
Step 4: Execute trade at price 50050 (close)
Step 5: Query candle API for this period
Step 7: Verify volume = sum of all trade amounts
Step 8: Verify quote_volume = sum of (price * amount) per trade
Step 9: Verify trade_count = 4
edgeCases: Single trade in period → O=H=L=C
No trades → carry-forward candle (O=H=L=C=prev close, V=0)
Trade at exact period boundary → belongs to new period

description: Trading pair selector modal with search, favorites, and real-time prices
acceptanceCriteria: Given the user clicks the pair name in the header
When the selector modal opens
Then all pairs are listed with search, favorites, and live prices
steps: Step 1: Click pair name in header bar
Step 2: Verify modal opens with list of all active pairs
Step 3: Type 'BTC' in search → filter to BTC pairs only
Step 4: Verify each pair shows: symbol, price, 24h change
Step 5: Click star to favorite a pair
Step 6: Switch to Favorites tab → see starred pairs
Step 7: Click on ETH/USDT
Step 8: Verify trading page navigates to /trade/ETH_USDT
Step 9: Verify modal closes after selection
Step 10: Test keyboard navigation (↑↓ to select, Enter to confirm)
edgeCases: No search results → 'No pairs found' message
Empty favorites → 'No favorites yet' message
Esc key closes modal

description: Markets page lists all trading pairs with 24h stats, search, and sort
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user navigates to /markets
When the page loads
Then all trading pairs are listed in a sortable, searchable table
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /markets
Step 2: Verify table with columns: Pair, Price, 24h Change, 24h Volume
Step 3: Verify prices update in real-time via WebSocket
Step 4: Type 'ETH' in search → filter results
Step 5: Click 'Price' column header → sort by price
Step 6: Click '24h Change' → sort by change percentage
Step 7: Click on BTC/USDT row → navigate to /trade/BTC_USDT
Step 8: Verify tab filters: All, USDT, BTC pairs
edgeCases: No pairs → empty state
Suspended pairs → not shown

description: Market-making bot creates realistic order book activity on startup
acceptanceCriteria: Given the server starts with seed data
When the bot is enabled
Then it places random orders around current price creating a realistic order book
steps: Step 1: Start dev server with market maker enabled
Step 2: Wait 5 seconds for bot initialization
Step 3: Check order book depth → verify multiple bid/ask levels
Step 4: Watch for trades executing (bot creates crossing orders)
Step 5: Verify chart shows candle data forming
Step 6: Verify recent trades panel shows activity
Step 7: Verify the bot can be disabled via config
edgeCases: Bot disabled → no automatic activity
Bot doesn't interfere with real user orders
notes: Educational component: students can study/modify the bot

description: Landing page displays hero section, CTA, and live ticker marquee
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user visits the root URL
When the page loads
Then they see a hero section, Start Trading CTA, and live price ticker
steps: Step 1: Navigate to http://localhost:3000
Step 2: Verify hero section with exchange name/tagline
Step 3: Verify 'Start Trading' CTA button
Step 4: Verify live ticker marquee showing pair prices
Step 5: Click CTA → navigate to /register or /trade
Step 6: Verify 3-4 feature highlight cards
Step 7: Verify ticker updates in real-time
edgeCases: WebSocket not connected → ticker shows static data
Already logged in → CTA says 'Go to Trading'

description: Wallet overview page shows total balance, allocation chart, and asset list
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user with balances
When they navigate to /wallet
Then they see total balance, allocation donut chart, and per-asset breakdown
steps: Step 1: Login and deposit multiple currencies
Step 2: Navigate to /wallet
Step 3: Verify total balance displayed in USDT equivalent
Step 4: Verify donut/pie chart shows allocation by asset
Step 5: Verify asset table: Currency, Available, Frozen, Total, Value
Step 6: Verify 'Hide small balances' toggle works
Step 7: Verify Deposit and Withdraw buttons per asset
Step 8: Click Deposit → navigate to deposit page
edgeCases: No balances → show empty state with deposit CTA
Single currency → donut shows 100%

description: Partial fills update order status and create multiple trades
acceptanceCriteria: Given a large buy order
When it matches against multiple smaller sell orders
Then multiple trades are created and order status is partially_filled
steps: Step 1: Place sell 0.3 BTC @ 50000
Step 2: Place sell 0.2 BTC @ 50001
Step 3: Place buy 1.0 BTC @ 50001 (limit)
Step 4: Verify two trades created: 0.3@50000 and 0.2@50001
Step 5: Verify buy order status = 'partially_filled', filled_amount = 0.5
Step 6: Verify remaining 0.5 rests in book at 50001
Step 7: Verify average price calculated correctly
Step 8: Cancel remaining → verify status = 'cancelled', filled_amount = 0.5
edgeCases: Dust remaining (< min lot size) → auto-fill or auto-cancel
All sells consumed → remaining becomes maker order

description: WebSocket kline channel pushes real-time candle updates
acceptanceCriteria: Given a client subscribes to kline@BTC_USDT@1m
When a trade executes
Then the current candle is pushed with updated OHLCV
steps: Step 1: Connect to WebSocket and subscribe to kline@BTC_USDT@1m
Step 2: Execute a trade
Step 3: Verify candle update received with correct OHLCV
Step 4: Verify isClosed=false for in-progress candle
Step 5: Wait for period boundary
Step 6: Verify candle with isClosed=true is pushed
Step 7: Verify new candle starts with open=previous close
edgeCases: No trades → carry-forward candle pushed at period boundary
Multiple trades in same second → all reflected in candle

description: Cancel all open orders for a trading pair in one request
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has multiple open orders for BTC_USDT
When they call DELETE /api/v1/orders?symbol=BTC_USDT
Then all open orders for that pair are cancelled
steps: Step 1: Place 5 different limit orders for BTC_USDT
Step 2: Place 2 orders for ETH_USDT (should not be affected)
Step 3: Call DELETE /api/v1/orders?symbol=BTC_USDT
Step 4: Verify all 5 BTC_USDT orders are cancelled
Step 5: Verify ETH_USDT orders remain open
Step 6: Verify all frozen balances for BTC_USDT orders are unfrozen
Step 7: Verify WS order.cancelled events received for each order
edgeCases: No open orders → success with count=0
Mixed filled/open → only cancel open ones

description: Order book depth bars visualize cumulative volume with semi-transparent backgrounds
acceptanceCriteria: Given the order book has data
When viewing the order book component
Then depth bars fill proportionally to cumulative volume
steps: Step 1: Load order book with varying quantities at different price levels
Step 2: Verify ask side has red semi-transparent depth bars
Step 3: Verify bid side has green semi-transparent depth bars
Step 4: Verify bars are proportional to volume at that level vs max
Step 5: Verify bars fill from right to left
Step 6: Verify the largest level has a full bar
edgeCases: Single level → full bar
Equal volumes → equal bars

description: Price flash animation on order book updates
acceptanceCriteria: Given the order book is displayed
When a price level updates
Then a brief flash animation highlights the changed row
steps: Step 1: Watch order book while trades are executing
Step 2: Verify rows flash green when bid quantity increases
Step 3: Verify rows flash red when ask quantity increases
Step 4: Verify flash fades out over ~600ms
Step 5: Verify prefers-reduced-motion disables animation
edgeCases: Rapid updates → last flash wins (no stacking)
prefers-reduced-motion → no animation

description: Buy button is green and sell button is red across all forms
acceptanceCriteria: Given the order form is displayed
When viewing buy and sell modes
Then buy button uses green (#0ECB81) and sell button uses red (#F6465D)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to trading page
Step 2: Select Buy mode → verify button is green with white text
Step 3: Select Sell mode → verify button is red with white text
Step 4: Verify buy/sell tab indicators match colors
Step 5: Verify percentage slider accent matches current mode color
edgeCases: Disabled button → muted version of the color
Hover state → slightly lighter shade

description: Toast notifications for order events: filled (green), partial (yellow), rejected (red)
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user places an order
When the order reaches a terminal state
Then a toast notification appears with appropriate color and content
steps: Step 1: Place a market order that fills immediately
Step 2: Verify green toast: 'Order Filled — Bought X BTC @ $Y'
Step 3: Place a partial fill scenario
Step 4: Verify yellow toast: 'Partial Fill — X of Y filled'
Step 5: Place order with insufficient balance
Step 6: Verify red toast: 'Order Rejected — Insufficient balance'
Step 7: Verify toasts auto-dismiss after 5 seconds
Step 8: Verify error toasts persist until manually dismissed
edgeCases: Multiple toasts → stack vertically
Toast includes actionable link (e.g., 'Deposit USDT')

description: Order form percentage slider allows 25/50/75/100% of available balance
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has available balance
When they click percentage buttons on the order form
Then the amount field is auto-filled to that percentage of available balance
steps: Step 1: Login with 10000 USDT available
Step 2: Set price to 50000 on buy form
Step 3: Click 25% button → amount = 0.05 BTC (25% of 10000/50000)
Step 4: Click 50% → amount = 0.1 BTC
Step 5: Click 75% → amount = 0.15 BTC
Step 6: Click 100% → amount = 0.2 BTC
Step 7: Verify total updates automatically
Step 8: Switch to sell mode → percentage applies to BTC available
edgeCases: Zero balance → all percentages show 0
100% accounts for fees

description: WebSocket connection status indicator in the trading page header
acceptanceCriteria: Given the trading page is loaded
When the WebSocket connection state changes
Then a visual indicator shows connected (green), connecting (yellow), or disconnected (red)
steps: Step 1: Load trading page → verify green dot indicator
Step 2: Simulate disconnect → verify yellow 'Reconnecting...' banner
Step 3: Verify auto-reconnect with exponential backoff
Step 4: On reconnect → verify green dot returns
Step 5: After max retries → verify red 'Connection lost' with manual retry button
edgeCases: Server restart → auto-reconnect succeeds
Stale data (>5s since last update) → show warning

description: Spread display between bid and ask sides of the order book
acceptanceCriteria: Given bid and ask orders exist
When viewing the order book
Then the spread is displayed between best bid and best ask
steps: Step 1: Populate order book with bids and asks
Step 2: Verify spread row between asks and bids sections
Step 3: Verify spread shows absolute value (e.g., '$5.00')
Step 4: Verify spread shows percentage (e.g., '0.01%')
Step 5: Verify spread updates in real-time
edgeCases: No asks → spread shows '--'
No bids → spread shows '--'
Spread = 0 (crossed book) → immediate matching occurs

description: Stop-loss orders trigger when price reaches stop price and execute as market orders
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user holds BTC and sets a stop-loss sell
When the market price drops to the stop price
Then the stop-loss converts to a market sell and executes
steps: Step 1: User has 1.0 BTC
Step 2: Place stop-loss sell: stopPrice=45000, amount=1.0
Step 3: Verify order status is 'new' (monitoring, not in book)
Step 4: Execute a trade at 45000 (triggers stop)
Step 5: Verify stop order converts to market sell
Step 6: Verify market sell executes against bids
Step 7: Verify user's BTC balance decreases
edgeCases: No bids when triggered → market order fails with insufficient_liquidity
Price gaps past stop → triggers at first trade below stop
Multiple stops at same level → all trigger in sequence

description: Stop-limit orders trigger at stop price and place a limit order at limit price
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user sets a stop-limit order
When the stop price is reached
Then a limit order is placed at the specified limit price
steps: Step 1: Place stop-limit sell: stopPrice=45000, limitPrice=44900, amount=1.0
Step 2: Execute trade at 45000 (triggers stop)
Step 3: Verify limit sell order placed at 44900
Step 4: Verify order appears in order book at 44900
Step 5: When matched at 44900 → trade executes
edgeCases: Limit price far from market → order rests in book
Stop triggers but limit can't fill → order sits in book

description: OCO orders link take-profit and stop-loss so one cancels the other
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user places an OCO order
When either the take-profit or stop-loss triggers
Then the other leg is automatically cancelled
steps: Step 1: Place OCO: take-profit sell@55000, stop-loss sell@45000, amount=1.0
Step 2: Verify two linked orders created
Step 3: Trade at 55000 → take-profit triggers and fills
Step 4: Verify stop-loss order auto-cancelled
Step 5: Verify oco_pair_id links the two orders
Step 6: Test reverse: stop-loss triggers → take-profit cancelled
edgeCases: Both prices hit in same trade → first triggered wins
Cancel one leg manually → other remains active

description: IOC (Immediate-Or-Cancel) fills what it can and cancels the rest
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user places an IOC order
When the order is submitted
Then it fills available liquidity immediately and cancels any remainder
steps: Step 1: Place sell 0.5@50000 in book
Step 2: Place IOC buy 1.0@50000
Step 3: Verify trade: 0.5@50000
Step 4: Verify remaining 0.5 is cancelled (not placed in book)
Step 5: Verify order final status has filled_amount=0.5
edgeCases: Full liquidity available → full fill, no cancel
Zero liquidity → immediate cancel, filled=0

description: FOK (Fill-Or-Kill) either fills completely or is rejected entirely
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user places a FOK order
When the book has insufficient liquidity
Then the entire order is rejected with no partial fills
steps: Step 1: Place sell 0.5@50000 in book (only liquidity)
Step 2: Place FOK buy 1.0@50000
Step 3: Verify order is cancelled with filled_amount=0
Step 4: Verify no trades created
Step 5: Verify user balance unchanged
Step 6: Place FOK buy 0.3@50000 → verify full fill
edgeCases: Exact match → fills
One share short → entire order rejected

description: Self-trade prevention cancels resting order when same user is on both sides
acceptanceCriteria: Given user A has a resting sell order
When user A places a buy order at the same price
Then the resting sell order is cancelled (not matched)
steps: Step 1: User A places sell 1.0@50000
Step 2: User A places buy 1.0@50000
Step 3: Verify sell order is cancelled
Step 4: Verify buy order remains (either fills against other orders or rests)
Step 5: Verify no self-trade is recorded
edgeCases: Different users at same price → normal match
STP with partial fills → cancel remaining resting

description: Price protection rejects orders that deviate more than 10% from last trade
acceptanceCriteria: Given the last trade was at 50000
When a user places a limit order at 60000 (20% above)
Then the order is rejected with price_exceeds_protection_range
steps: Step 1: Execute trade at 50000 to establish last price
Step 2: Place buy limit at 55001 (10.002% above) → rejected
Step 3: Place buy limit at 54999 (9.998% above) → accepted
Step 4: Place sell limit at 44999 (10.002% below) → rejected
Step 5: Verify error message includes max allowed range
edgeCases: No last price (first trade ever) → protection skipped
Admin can configure the percentage per pair

description: 2FA (TOTP) setup flow with QR code and verification
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user wants to enable 2FA
When they complete the setup flow
Then TOTP is enabled and required on subsequent logins
steps: Step 1: Navigate to security settings
Step 2: Click 'Enable 2FA'
Step 3: Verify QR code displayed for Google Authenticator
Step 4: Verify secret key shown as text backup
Step 5: Enter 6-digit code from authenticator app
Step 6: Verify 2FA is now enabled
Step 7: Logout and login again
Step 8: Verify 2FA code prompt appears after password
Step 9: Enter correct code → login succeeds
Step 10: Enter wrong code → login fails
edgeCases: Scan QR but never verify → 2FA not enabled
Try to enable twice → 'Already enabled' message
Admin can disable user's 2FA via admin panel

description: KYC Level 1 simulated phone verification
acceptanceCriteria: Given a Level 0 user
When they submit phone verification
Then they are auto-approved to Level 1
steps: Step 1: Login as Level 0 user
Step 2: Navigate to /account/kyc
Step 3: See current level: Level 0
Step 4: Click 'Verify Phone'
Step 5: Enter phone number
Step 6: Enter any 6-digit code (simulated)
Step 7: Verify KYC level updated to Level 1
Step 8: Verify kyc_verifications record created
edgeCases: Already Level 1+ → show current level, no re-verification needed
Invalid phone format → validation error

description: KYC Level 2 simulated document upload and admin review
acceptanceCriteria: Given a Level 1 user
When they submit ID documents
Then the submission enters pending review status
steps: Step 1: Login as Level 1 user
Step 2: Navigate to /account/kyc
Step 3: Select document type (ID card/passport)
Step 4: Upload front image (any image accepted)
Step 5: Upload back image
Step 6: Upload selfie
Step 7: Submit for review
Step 8: Verify status changes to 'pending'
Step 9: Admin logs in and reviews in KYC queue
Step 10: Admin approves → user becomes Level 2
edgeCases: Non-image file → validation error
Already Level 2 → no re-submission needed
Admin rejects → user can resubmit

description: Simulated withdrawal with multi-step status tracking
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user with balance
When they submit a withdrawal request
Then the withdrawal progresses through status states
steps: Step 1: Navigate to wallet withdrawal page
Step 2: Select currency (USDT)
Step 3: Select network (ERC20/TRC20)
Step 4: Enter withdrawal address
Step 5: Enter amount (verify fee shown)
Step 6: Confirm withdrawal
Step 7: See status: pending_approval → processing → confirming → completed
Step 8: Verify balance decreased by amount + fee
Step 9: Verify simulated tx_hash generated
Step 10: Verify withdrawal record in history
edgeCases: Insufficient balance → rejected
Amount below minimum → validation error
Exceeds daily limit → rejected with message

description: Transaction history shows deposits and withdrawals with filters
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has deposit and withdrawal history
When they navigate to transaction history
Then all transactions are listed with status and filters
steps: Step 1: Complete several deposits and withdrawals
Step 2: Navigate to /wallet/history
Step 3: Verify table shows: Time, Type, Asset, Amount, Status, TxID
Step 4: Filter by type: All/Deposit/Withdrawal
Step 5: Verify deposits show with green color/icon
Step 6: Verify withdrawals show with red color/icon
Step 7: Verify pagination for many transactions
edgeCases: No transactions → empty state
Filter returns no results → 'No transactions found'

description: Admin dashboard displays KPIs: total users, 24h volume, revenue, pending KYC
acceptanceCriteria: Given an admin user is logged in
When they navigate to /admin
Then dashboard shows real-time KPI cards and charts
steps: Step 1: Login as admin
Step 2: Navigate to /admin
Step 3: Verify KPI card: Total Users count
Step 4: Verify KPI card: 24h Volume in USDT
Step 5: Verify KPI card: 24h Fee Revenue
Step 6: Verify KPI card: Pending KYC count
Step 7: Verify per-pair volume breakdown
Step 8: Verify charts render (volume, user growth)
edgeCases: No data → cards show 0 or '--'
Non-admin user → 403 forbidden

description: Admin trading pair CRUD: create, update, enable/disable pairs
acceptanceCriteria: Given an admin user
When they manage trading pairs
Then they can create, edit, and disable pairs
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /admin/pairs
Step 2: Verify all pairs listed with status
Step 3: Click 'Add Pair'
Step 4: Fill form: symbol, precision, fees, min amounts
Step 5: Submit → pair created
Step 6: Edit an existing pair's fees
Step 7: Disable a pair → all open orders cancelled
Step 8: Verify disabled pair hidden from public API
Step 9: Re-enable pair → pair active again
edgeCases: Disable pair with open orders → force cancel all + unfreeze
Duplicate symbol → error
Invalid precision → validation error

description: Admin fee configuration: set maker/taker fees per trading pair
acceptanceCriteria: Given an admin user
When they update fee settings for a pair
Then new trades use the updated fee rates
steps: Step 1: Navigate to admin fee configuration
Step 2: View current maker/taker fees for BTC_USDT
Step 3: Update maker fee to 8 bps (0.08%)
Step 4: Update taker fee to 12 bps (0.12%)
Step 5: Save changes
Step 6: Execute a trade on BTC_USDT
Step 7: Verify maker fee = 0.08% of trade amount
Step 8: Verify taker fee = 0.12% of trade amount
edgeCases: Negative fee (rebate) → rejected for MVP
Zero fee → accepted
Fee change doesn't affect existing open orders

description: Admin user management: list, search, freeze/unfreeze users
acceptanceCriteria: Given an admin user
When they manage users
Then they can search, view details, and freeze/unfreeze accounts
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /admin/users
Step 2: Verify user list with columns: ID, Email, KYC, Balance, Status
Step 3: Search by email → filtered results
Step 4: Click user → view detail panel
Step 5: Click 'Freeze' → user status = suspended
Step 6: Verify frozen user cannot login
Step 7: Click 'Unfreeze' → user status = active
Step 8: Verify audit log entry created for freeze action
edgeCases: Freeze admin → should be prevented or require confirmation
Freeze user with open orders → orders remain (not auto-cancelled)

description: Admin KYC review queue: approve/reject submissions with reason
acceptanceCriteria: Given there are pending KYC submissions
When admin reviews them
Then they can approve or reject with a reason
steps: Step 1: Submit Level 2 KYC as regular user
Step 2: Login as admin, navigate to KYC queue
Step 3: Verify pending submission visible
Step 4: Click submission → view documents
Step 5: Click 'Approve' → user level updated to Level 2
Step 6: Verify user notified via WS
Step 7: Submit another KYC, reject it with reason
Step 8: Verify user sees rejection reason and can resubmit
edgeCases: No pending submissions → empty queue
Approve already approved → no-op

description: Audit logs track all admin actions with details
acceptanceCriteria: Given admin actions are performed
When viewing the audit log
Then all actions are logged with timestamp, admin, action, and details
steps: Step 1: Admin performs several actions (freeze user, update fees, approve KYC)
Step 2: Navigate to /admin/audit-logs
Step 3: Verify each action has timestamp, admin email, action type
Step 4: Verify details column shows action-specific info
Step 5: Verify pagination works
Step 6: Verify logs are immutable (cannot be deleted)
edgeCases: No actions → empty log
Many actions → paginated

description: Order validation checks precision, min/max amounts, and notional value
acceptanceCriteria: Given a trading pair with specific precision and limits
When a user places an order violating these
Then the order is rejected with a specific error message
steps: Step 1: BTC_USDT has amountPrecision=6, pricePrecision=2
Step 2: Place order with amount=0.0000001 (7 decimals) → rejected
Step 3: Place order with price=50000.001 (3 decimals) → rejected
Step 4: Place order below minAmount → rejected
Step 5: Place order below minTotal (notional) → rejected
Step 6: Place valid order → accepted
Step 7: Verify each rejection has specific error code
edgeCases: Exactly at min → accepted
Price = 0 → rejected
Amount = 0 → rejected

description: Rate limiting restricts order placement to 5 orders per second per user
acceptanceCriteria: Given rate limits are configured
When a user submits more than 5 orders per second
Then excess orders are rejected with 429 status
steps: Step 1: Rapidly place 6 orders in 1 second
Step 2: Verify first 5 succeed
Step 3: Verify 6th returns 429 Too Many Requests
Step 4: Wait 1 second
Step 5: Verify next order succeeds
Step 6: Verify rate limit applies per-user (different user not affected)
edgeCases: Rate limit applies to order placement only, not queries
Admin endpoints have separate rate limits

description: Matching engine rebuilds order book from database on server restart
acceptanceCriteria: Given the server crashes or restarts
When it comes back up
Then the order book is rebuilt from open orders in the database
steps: Step 1: Place several limit orders (some partially filled)
Step 2: Record the order book state
Step 3: Restart the server
Step 4: Wait for startup to complete
Step 5: Query order book depth
Step 6: Verify book matches pre-restart state
Step 7: Place new crossing order → trades execute correctly
edgeCases: Empty order book → rebuilds empty
10k+ orders → rebuilds within 2 seconds
Partially filled orders → only remaining amount in book

description: Historical candle API returns paginated OHLCV data
acceptanceCriteria: Given candles exist in the database
When calling GET /api/v1/market/candles/:symbol
Then paginated candle data is returned
steps: Step 1: Ensure candle data exists (via bot or manual trades)
Step 2: Call GET /api/v1/market/candles/BTC_USDT?interval=1m&limit=100
Step 3: Verify response contains array of candle objects
Step 4: Each candle has openTime, open, high, low, close, volume
Step 5: Verify candles are sorted by openTime ascending
Step 6: Test different intervals: 1m, 5m, 1h, 1d
Step 7: Verify limit parameter works (default 500, max 1000)
edgeCases: No candles → empty array
Invalid interval → 400 error
Future time range → empty

description: Chart supports technical indicators: MA, EMA, RSI, MACD, Bollinger Bands
acceptanceCriteria: Given the chart is displayed with candle data
When a user adds technical indicators
Then they render correctly on or below the chart
steps: Step 1: Click 'Indicators' button on chart header
Step 2: Select 'MA(7)' → verify moving average line on chart
Step 3: Select 'EMA(25)' → verify exponential MA line
Step 4: Select 'RSI(14)' → verify RSI in separate pane below
Step 5: Select 'MACD' → verify MACD histogram in separate pane
Step 6: Select 'Bollinger Bands(20)' → verify bands on chart
Step 7: Remove an indicator → verify it disappears
edgeCases: Insufficient data for period → indicator partial or hidden
Multiple indicators → all render without overlap

description: Order form confirmation dialog for market orders and large orders
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user submits a market order
When the order is about to be placed
Then a confirmation dialog shows order details before execution
steps: Step 1: Place market buy order
Step 2: Verify confirmation dialog appears
Step 3: Dialog shows: Side, Type, Amount, Estimated Total, Fee
Step 4: Click 'Confirm Buy' → order executes
Step 5: Click 'Cancel' → order not placed
Step 6: Verify 'Don't show again' checkbox works
edgeCases: Limit orders → no confirmation by default (configurable)
'Don't show again' persists in localStorage

description: Login page with email/password form and password visibility toggle
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user navigates to /login
When the page loads
Then a clean login form is displayed with proper styling
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /login
Step 2: Verify centered card layout with logo
Step 3: Verify email input with label and placeholder
Step 4: Verify password input with label and visibility toggle
Step 5: Click eye icon → password visible
Step 6: Verify Login button styling (primary color)
Step 7: Verify 'Register' link below form
Step 8: Verify form validation messages style correctly
edgeCases: Mobile → form fills full width
Error state → red border on invalid fields

description: Registration page with password strength meter
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user navigates to /register
When typing a password
Then a real-time strength meter shows password quality
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /register
Step 2: Verify form layout matches login page style
Step 3: Type 'abc' → strength meter shows 'Weak' in red
Step 4: Type 'Abc1234' → shows 'Medium' in yellow
Step 5: Type 'Abc1234!' → shows 'Strong' in green
Step 6: Verify requirement checklist updates in real-time
Step 7: Verify Terms of Service checkbox
edgeCases: Empty password → no strength shown
Paste password → strength updates

description: Order book precision selector dropdown changes price aggregation
acceptanceCriteria: Given the order book is displayed
When the user changes precision
Then price levels are aggregated to the selected precision
steps: Step 1: Verify precision dropdown at bottom of order book
Step 2: Default precision matches pair's price_precision
Step 3: Select lower precision (e.g., 0.1 → 1)
Step 4: Verify price levels aggregate (sum quantities)
Step 5: Select higher precision (e.g., 1 → 0.01)
Step 6: Verify more price levels shown
edgeCases: Only one precision option → dropdown disabled
Zero orders at aggregated level → level hidden

description: Admin sidebar navigation with icons and active state highlighting
acceptanceCriteria: Given an admin user is on the admin pages
When navigating between sections
Then the sidebar shows icons, labels, and highlights the active section
steps: Step 1: Login as admin, navigate to /admin
Step 2: Verify sidebar with sections: Dashboard, Users, Trading, Finance, Audit, Settings
Step 3: Verify each section has an icon
Step 4: Click 'Users' → sidebar highlights Users
Step 5: Verify subsections expand (Users → User List, KYC Queue)
Step 6: Verify badge shows pending KYC count
edgeCases: Mobile → sidebar collapses to hamburger menu
Zero pending → no badge shown

description: Admin dashboard KPI cards with trend indicators
acceptanceCriteria: Given the admin dashboard is loaded
When viewing KPI cards
Then each card shows the value and trend arrow (up/down)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /admin
Step 2: Verify 4 KPI cards: Users, Volume, Revenue, Pending KYC
Step 3: Verify each card has: large number, trend percentage
Step 4: Verify green arrow for positive trends
Step 5: Verify red arrow for negative trends
edgeCases: No data → show 0 with no trend
First day → no trend comparison

description: Security settings page with 2FA status and password management
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user navigates to security settings
When the page loads
Then they see 2FA status, password change, and login history
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /account/security
Step 2: Verify password section with 'Change Password' button
Step 3: Verify 2FA section showing enabled/disabled status
Step 4: Verify login history section with recent logins
Step 5: Verify security level indicator (strength bar)
edgeCases: 2FA not set up → show 'Enable 2FA' button
No login history → show empty state

description: Password change requires old password and validates new password strength
acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user
When they change their password
Then the old password is verified and new password must meet requirements
steps: Step 1: Navigate to security settings
Step 2: Click Change Password
Step 3: Enter current password
Step 4: Enter new password (must meet strength requirements)
Step 5: Confirm new password
Step 6: Submit → password updated
Step 7: Logout and login with new password → success
Step 8: Try login with old password → fails
edgeCases: Wrong old password → error
New password same as old → error
New password too weak → validation error

description: Login history shows recent login attempts with IP, device, and status
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has logged in multiple times
When they view login history
Then recent logins are listed with details
steps: Step 1: Login from different browsers/sessions
Step 2: Navigate to /account/login-history
Step 3: Verify list shows: Time, IP Address, Device/Browser, Status
Step 4: Verify successful logins show green checkmark
Step 5: Verify failed attempts show red X with reason
edgeCases: No login history → empty state
Many entries → paginated

description: Order form Stop-Limit tab with trigger price and limit price inputs
acceptanceCriteria: Given the order form has Stop-Limit tab
When user fills and submits
Then a stop-limit order is created
steps: Step 1: Click Stop-Limit tab in order form
Step 2: Verify stop price input with tooltip explaining trigger
Step 3: Verify limit price input
Step 4: Enter stop price, limit price, amount
Step 5: Verify form validates stop price direction (sell stop < market)
Step 6: Submit → order created in monitoring state
Step 7: Verify order appears in Open Orders with type 'stop_limit'
edgeCases: Stop price above market for sell → validation error
Stop price = market price → triggers immediately

description: Order form OCO tab with take-profit and stop-loss sections
acceptanceCriteria: Given the order form has OCO tab
When user fills both legs
Then linked OCO orders are created
steps: Step 1: Click OCO tab in order form
Step 2: Fill take-profit section: price above market
Step 3: Fill stop-loss section: stop price below market, limit price
Step 4: Enter shared amount
Step 5: Submit → two linked orders created
Step 6: Verify both appear in Open Orders
Step 7: Verify 'OCO' label on both orders
edgeCases: Take-profit price below market → validation error
Stop price above market → validation error

description: My trades page shows execution history with fill details
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user has completed trades
When they view their trade history
Then individual fills are listed with price, amount, fee, and role
steps: Step 1: Execute several trades as both maker and taker
Step 2: Navigate to /orders (Trade History tab)
Step 3: Verify columns: Time, Pair, Side, Price, Amount, Fee, Role
Step 4: Verify maker fills labeled as 'Maker'
Step 5: Verify taker fills labeled as 'Taker'

edgeCases: No trades → empty state
Filter by pair → only that pair shown

description: Public recent trades API returns last 50 trades for a pair
acceptanceCriteria: Given trades have been executed
When calling GET /api/v1/market/trades/:symbol
Then the last 50 trades are returned in reverse chronological order
steps: Step 1: Execute several trades on BTC_USDT
Step 2: Call GET /api/v1/market/trades/BTC_USDT?limit=50
Step 3: Verify response contains trade objects
Step 4: Each trade has: price, amount, side, timestamp
Step 5: Verify ordered by timestamp descending
Step 6: Test limit parameter
edgeCases: No trades → empty array
limit=0 → default (50)

description: 24h ticker API returns comprehensive market statistics
acceptanceCriteria: Given trades have occurred in the last 24h
When calling GET /api/v1/market/ticker/:symbol
Then complete 24h statistics are returned
steps: Step 1: Execute trades over time on BTC_USDT
Step 2: Call GET /api/v1/market/ticker/BTC_USDT
Step 3: Verify lastPrice matches latest trade
Step 4: Verify highPrice/lowPrice for 24h range
Step 5: Verify volume is sum of all trade amounts in 24h
Step 6: Verify priceChangePercent computed correctly
Step 7: Call GET /api/v1/market/ticker for all tickers
edgeCases: No trades in 24h → all zeros
Single trade → high=low=last

description: Logout invalidates refresh token and clears session
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user is logged in
When they call POST /api/v1/auth/logout
Then the refresh token is invalidated and session cleared
steps: Step 1: Login to get tokens
Step 2: Call POST /api/v1/auth/logout with refresh token
Step 3: Verify logout returns success
Step 4: Attempt to refresh with old token → 401
Step 5: Verify access token still works until expiry
Step 6: Verify UI redirects to login page
edgeCases: Already logged out → success (idempotent)
Invalid token → success (no error)

description: Wallet deposit page with currency selector, amount input, and confirmation animation
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user navigates to the deposit page
When the page loads
Then they see currency selector, amount input, and professional deposit UI
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /wallet/deposit
Step 2: Verify currency selector dropdown
Step 3: Select USDT → verify simulated address and QR code displayed
Step 4: Select network (ERC20/TRC20)
Step 5: Enter amount
Step 6: Click 'Deposit' → see confirmation progress
Step 7: Verify animated progress bar (1/3, 2/3, 3/3)
edgeCases: Invalid amount → validation error
Network warning displayed prominently

description: Wallet withdrawal page with address input, network selector, and fee display
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user navigates to the withdrawal page
When the page loads

steps: Step 1: Navigate to /wallet/withdraw
Step 2: Select currency
Step 3: Select network
Step 4: Enter withdrawal address
Step 5: Enter amount → see fee and receive amount calculated
Step 6: Verify summary card before confirmation
Step 7: Verify bold network warning message
edgeCases: Wrong network warning → prominent red banner
Amount > available → disabled submit

description: Empty state illustrations for tables with no data
acceptanceCriteria: Given a table has no data
When the component renders

steps: Step 1: Login as new user with no orders
Step 2: Navigate to Open Orders → see 'No open orders' + illustration
Step 3: Navigate to Trade History → see 'No trades yet' message
Step 4: Navigate to Wallet → see 'No assets' + Deposit CTA
Step 5: Verify each empty state has a relevant call-to-action button
edgeCases: Loading state shown before empty state
Empty state disappears when data arrives

description: Admin system config: maintenance mode, registration toggle, max open orders
acceptanceCriteria: Given an admin user
When they update system config
Then the settings take effect immediately
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /admin/config
Step 2: Toggle maintenance mode on
Step 3: Verify trading endpoints return 503
Step 4: Toggle maintenance mode off
Step 5: Set max_open_orders_per_user to 50
Step 6: Verify user with 50 orders cannot place more
Step 7: Toggle registration off → /register returns error
edgeCases: Invalid config value → validation error
Config changes logged in audit log

description: WebSocket reconnection with exponential backoff and snapshot recovery
acceptanceCriteria: Given a WebSocket connection drops
When the client reconnects
Then it uses exponential backoff and receives a fresh snapshot
steps: Step 1: Establish WS connection and subscribe to depth
Step 2: Simulate disconnect (server-side)
Step 3: Verify client retries: 1s, 2s, 4s, 8s, 16s, 30s max
Step 4: On reconnect, verify fresh depth snapshot received
Step 5: Verify lastUpdateId is current (not stale)
Step 6: After 10 failures → show manual retry button
edgeCases: Server restarts → client reconnects automatically
Network flap → reconnects without data loss

description: Mobile layout (375px) uses tab-based navigation with sticky order form
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user views the trading page on mobile
When the viewport is 375px
Then the layout switches to single-column with tab navigation
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to 375px width
Step 2: Verify bottom navigation bar: Home, Markets, Trade, Wallet, Account
Step 3: Verify trading page shows tab switcher: Chart, Book, Trades
Step 4: Verify only one panel visible at a time
Step 5: Verify sticky order form at bottom
Step 6: Swipe between tabs
edgeCases: Orientation change → layout adapts
Very small screen (320px) → still usable

description: Tablet layout (768px) stacks chart above side-by-side order book and form
acceptanceCriteria: Given a user views the trading page on tablet
When the viewport is 768px

Step 2: Verify chart takes full width
Step 3: Verify order book and order form are side by side below chart
Step 4: Verify open orders panel below

edgeCases: iPad landscape (1024px) → uses desktop layout
iPad portrait (768px) → tablet layout

edgeCases: Dynamic content updates → aria-live regions update

description: Color contrast meets WCAG 2.1 AA (4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for large text)

Step 2: Verify primary text on dark background ≥ 4.5:1
Step 3: Verify secondary text on dark background ≥ 4.5:1

edgeCases: Buy/sell not distinguishable by color alone (use ▲/▼ arrows too)
